name: Schnick Schnack Schnuck
instructions: Rock–paper–scissors or Scissor-Paper-Rock, is a zero-sum hand game usually played between two people, in which each player simultaneously forms one of three shapes with an outstretched hand. These shapes are 'rock' (✊ a simple fist), 'paper' (✋ a flat hand), and 'scissors' (✌️ a fist with the index and middle fingers together forming a V). The game has only three possible outcomes other than a tie: a player who decides to play rock will beat another player who has chosen scissors ('rock crushes scissors') but will lose to one who has played paper ('paper covers rock'); a play of paper will lose to a play of scissors ('scissors cut paper'). If both players choose the same shape, the game is tied and is immediately replayed to break the tie. - Rock–paper–scissors. (2017, March 10). In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 15:15, April 3, 2017, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Rock%E2%80%93paper%E2%80%93scissors&oldid=769516750

name: Münzschnackeln
instructions: Put a cup or a glas on a table 10cm from the edge. Take a small coin (e.g. a penny) into your flat hand. Now hit the edge of the table with your hand such that the penny lands in the glas. Ties are broken immediately by replaying until one player hits and the other does not (a slightly different modus is possible: like Elfmeterschiesen)

name: Mundfangen
instructions: Somebody throws something and somebody catches something.
